title: Alleged plans to ring bark trees as part of the Streets Ahead PFI programme of works

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide any documents related to correspondence between Sheffield City Council officers and Streets Ahead contractor Amey, and or their sub contractors, having specific regard to the topic of possible 'ring barking' of highway trees as a tactic to circumvent public protests against planned highway street tree fellings arising through the Streets Ahead PFI.
Yours faithfully,
Richard Ward.

Dear Richard Ward,
Thank you for your request for information relating to ring barking
consideration which we received on 05/08/2021.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Please be aware that Sheffield City Council’s response to the global
COVID-19 pandemic has led to a reduction in resources across the Council,
meaning that we are currently dealing with a backlog of requests.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 03/09/2021, but we kindly ask for your patience
as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not
hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
